poi_list.name: Louvre Museum
poi_list.description: Home to thousands of works of art, including the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo, the Louvre is a historic monument and the world's largest art museum.

poi_list.name: Eiffel Tower
poi_list.description: A global cultural icon of France and one of the most recognisable structures in the world, the Eiffel Tower offers breathtaking views from its platforms.

poi_list.name: Luxembourg Gardens
poi_list.description: Known for its lawns, tree-lined promenades, flowerbeds, model sailboats on its circular basin, and picturesque Medici Fountain, perfect for a relaxing stroll.

poi_list.name: Montmartre
poi_list.description: This historic area is known for its bohemian lifestyle, the Basilica of the Sacré-Cœur, and as a haven for artists, offering stunning views over Paris.

poi_list.name: Le Marais
poi_list.description: A historic district spread across parts of the 3rd and 4th arrondissements, known for its vibrant street life, boutiques, galleries, and the Jewish Quarter.

poi_list.name: Seine River Cruise
poi_list.description: Experience the beauty of Paris from its historic river, passing by many of its iconic landmarks, perfect for an evening of relaxation and sightseeing.

poi_list.name: Versailles Palace
poi_list.description: A symbol of the absolute monarchy of the Ancien Régime, this opulent palace is renowned for its Hall of Mirrors, the Gardens of Versailles, and the Royal Opera.

poi_list.name: Rue Cler Market
poi_list.description: A charming pedestrian street known for its permanent market where visitors can shop for gourmet French products, fresh produce, and enjoy local eateries.

poi_list.name: Moulin Rouge
poi_list.description: The birthplace of the modern form of the can-can dance, this historic night club offers spectacular musical dance entertainment for its visitors.
